What is the purpose of the "fromaccount" argument when sending VRSC, and what value should it be set to?
The "fromaccount" argument is used to specify the account to send VRSC from. It should be set to an empty string "" to represent the default account. Any other string value will result in an error.

#### Arguments:
1. "fromaccount"     (string, required) MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.
2. "amounts"       (string, required) A json object with addresses and amounts
```json
  {
   "address":amount  (numeric) The VRSC address is the key, the numeric amount in VRSC is the value
   ,...
  }
```
3. minconf         (numeric, optional, default=1) Only use the balance confirmed at least this many times.
4. "comment"       (string, optional) A comment
5. subtractfeefromamount  (string, optional) A json array with addresses. The fee will be equally deducted from the amount of each selected address. Those recipients will receive less VRSC than you enter in their corresponding amount field. If no addresses are specified here, the sender pays the fee.
```json
  [
   "address"      (string) Subtract fee from this address
   ,...
  ]
```#### Result:
"transactionid"     (string) The transaction id for the send. Only 1 transaction is created regardless of the number of addresses.Examples:
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-02_verus_commands.md
How do I specify the amounts and addresses when sending VRSC?

You specify the amounts and addresses using a JSON object with addresses as keys and amounts as values. For example:
```json
{
  "address1": amount1,
  "address2": amount2,
 ...
}
```

#### Arguments:
1. "fromaccount"     (string, required) MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.
2. "amounts"       (string, required) A json object with addresses and amounts
```json
  {
   "address":amount  (numeric) The VRSC address is the key, the numeric amount in VRSC is the value
   ,...
  }
```
3. minconf         (numeric, optional, default=1) Only use the balance confirmed at least this many times.
4. "comment"       (string, optional) A comment
5. subtractfeefromamount  (string, optional) A json array with addresses. The fee will be equally deducted from the amount of each selected address. Those recipients will receive less VRSC than you enter in their corresponding amount field. If no addresses are specified here, the sender pays the fee.
```json
  [
   "address"      (string) Subtract fee from this address
   ,...
  ]
```#### Result:
"transactionid"     (string) The transaction id for the send. Only 1 transaction is created regardless of the number of addresses.Examples:
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-02_verus_commands.md
What is the "minconf" argument used for when sending VRSC, and what is its default value?
The "minconf" argument is used to specify the minimum number of confirmations required for the balance to be used for the transaction. Its default value is 1.

#### Arguments:
1. "fromaccount"     (string, required) MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.
2. "amounts"       (string, required) A json object with addresses and amounts
```json
  {
   "address":amount  (numeric) The VRSC address is the key, the numeric amount in VRSC is the value
   ,...
  }
```
3. minconf         (numeric, optional, default=1) Only use the balance confirmed at least this many times.
4. "comment"       (string, optional) A comment
5. subtractfeefromamount  (string, optional) A json array with addresses. The fee will be equally deducted from the amount of each selected address. Those recipients will receive less VRSC than you enter in their corresponding amount field. If no addresses are specified here, the sender pays the fee.
```json
  [
   "address"      (string) Subtract fee from this address
   ,...
  ]
```#### Result:
"transactionid"     (string) The transaction id for the send. Only 1 transaction is created regardless of the number of addresses.Examples:
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-02_verus_commands.md
How do I specify a comment when sending VRSC, and is it required?
You can specify a comment using the "comment" argument. It is an optional argument, and you can omit it if you don't want to include a comment.

#### Arguments:
1. "fromaccount"     (string, required) MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.
2. "amounts"       (string, required) A json object with addresses and amounts

   "address":amount  (numeric) The VRSC address is the key, the numeric amount in VRSC is the value

3. minconf         (numeric, optional, default=1) Only use the balance confirmed at least this many times.

5. subtractfeefromamount  (string, optional) A json array with addresses. The fee will be equally deducted from the amount of each selected address. Those recipients will receive less VRSC than you enter in their corresponding amount field. If no addresses are specified here, the sender pays the fee.

How do I specify which addresses should have the fee deducted from their amounts when sending VRSC?

You can specify which addresses should have the fee deducted from their amounts using the "subtractfeefromamount" argument. It should be a JSON array with the addresses that should have the fee deducted. For example:
```json
[
  "address1",
  "address2",
 ...
]
```
If you don't specify any addresses, the sender will pay the fee.

#### Arguments:
1. "fromaccount"     (string, required) MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.
2. "amounts"       (string, required) A json object with addresses and amounts
```json
  {
   "address":amount  (numeric) The VRSC address is the key, the numeric amount in VRSC is the value
   ,...
  }
```
3. minconf         (numeric, optional, default=1) Only use the balance confirmed at least this many times.
4. "comment"       (string, optional) A comment
5. subtractfeefromamount  (string, optional) A json array with addresses. The fee will be equally deducted from the amount of each selected address. Those recipients will receive less VRSC than you enter in their corresponding amount field. If no addresses are specified here, the sender pays the fee.
```json
  [
   "address"      (string) Subtract fee from this address
   ,...
  ]
```#### Result:
"transactionid"     (string) The transaction id for the send. Only 1 transaction is created regardless of the number of addresses.Examples:
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-02_verus_commands.md
What is the result of sending VRSC, and how many transactions are created?
The result of sending VRSC is a transaction ID, and only one transaction is created regardless of the number of addresses specified.

#### Arguments:
1. "fromaccount"     (string, required) MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.
2. "amounts"       (string, required) A json object with addresses and amounts
```json
  {
   "address":amount  (numeric) The VRSC address is the key, the numeric amount in VRSC is the value
   ,...
  }
```
3. minconf         (numeric, optional, default=1) Only use the balance confirmed at least this many times.
4. "comment"       (string, optional) A comment
5. subtractfeefromamount  (string, optional) A json array with addresses. The fee will be equally deducted from the amount of each selected address. Those recipients will receive less VRSC than you enter in their corresponding amount field. If no addresses are specified here, the sender pays the fee.
```json
  [
   "address"      (string) Subtract fee from this address
   ,...
  ]
```#### Result:
"transactionid"     (string) The transaction id for the send. Only 1 transaction is created regardless of the number of addresses.Examples:
